title: “flying display” means any flying activity deliberately performed for the
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Irish Aviation Authority (Flying
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Irish Aviation Authority (Flying 

Displays) Order 2023. 

Definitions
text_norm: 1 order may cited irish aviation authority (flying displays) order 2023 definition

title: “flying display” means any flying activity deliberately performed for the
heading: In this Order:
text_raw:
2. 

In this Order: 

“flying display” means any flying activity deliberately performed for the 
purpose of providing an exhibition or entertainment at: 

a. 

an advertised event open to the public; or 

b. 
accordance with 
Regulation (EU) No 923/2012, specifically, SERA.5005(f); 

a private event which would require a permission to operate in 
the requirements of Commission Implementing 

“Flying Display Director” means a natural person responsible for the safe 
conduct of a flying display conducted pursuant to a permission issued by 
the Authority; 

“operator” means, for the purpose of the application of any provision of 
this Order in relation to any particular aircraft, reference to the person 
who at the relevant time has the management of that aircraft; 

“permission” means the document issued by the Authority permitting the 
proposed flying activity to take place; 

“pilot-in-command” means the pilot designated by the operator as being 
in command and charged with the safe conduct of its flight, without 
being under the direction of any other pilot in the aircraft; 

“the Act” means the Irish Aviation Authority Act, 1993 (No. 29 of 1993) 
as amended; 

“the Authority” means the Irish Aviation Authority; 

“the EASA Regulation” means Regulation (EU) 2018/1139 of the 
European Parliament and of the Council of 4 July 2018 and shall include 
any rules or regulations adopted by the European Commission in 
accordance with the EASA regulation; 

Applicability

title: “flying display” means any flying activity deliberately performed for the
heading: 3. This order shall apply, unless otherwise specified herein, to flying
text_raw:
3. This order shall apply, unless otherwise specified herein, to flying 

displays conducted in the State. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 7th February, 2023.

title: “flying display” means any flying activity deliberately performed for the
heading: 4. This Order shall not apply to—
text_raw:
4. This Order shall not apply to— 

(a) 

a flying display which takes place at an aerodrome under the 
control of the Minister for Defence; or 

(b) State Aircraft, or 

(c) 

a flying display at which the only participating aircraft are 
balloons; or 

(d) A flying display at which the only participating aircraft are 

UAS. 

Flying Displays
text_norm: 4 order shall apply to-- (a) flying display take place aerodrome control minister defence (b) state aircraft (c) flying display participating aircraft balloon (d) flying display participating aircraft uas flying display

text_raw:

title: “flying display” means any flying activity deliberately performed for the
heading: 6. A flying display shall not take place without a Flying Display Director.
text_raw: 6. A flying display shall not take place without a Flying Display Director.
text_norm: 6 flying display shall take place without flying display director

title: “flying display” means any flying activity deliberately performed for the
heading: 7. A person must apply to the Authority for permission to act as a Flying
text_raw:
7. A person must apply to the Authority for permission to act as a Flying 

Display Director for each specific flying display.
text_norm: 7 person must apply authority permission act flying display director specific flying display

title: “flying display” means any flying activity deliberately performed for the
heading: 8. A person may not act as a Flying Display Director of any flying
text_raw:
8. A person may not act as a Flying Display Director of any flying 
display, without first applying for and obtaining the permission of the 
Authority for that specific flying display.
text_norm: 8 person may act flying display director flying display without first applying obtaining permission authority specific flying display

title: “flying display” means any flying activity deliberately performed for the
heading: 9. A person granted permission to act as a Flying Display Director for a
text_raw:
9. A person granted permission to act as a Flying Display Director for a 
flying display must comply with any conditions as the Authority may 
determine.
text_norm: 9 person granted permission act flying display director flying display must comply condition authority may determine

title: “flying display” means any flying activity deliberately performed for the
heading: 10. A permission issued under this Order shall not purport to grant any
text_raw:
10. A permission issued under this Order shall not purport to grant any 
additional permission, privilege, or exemption to aircraft operators, pilots, or 
aircraft, as may be required under the Act or any of the Orders or Directions 
thereunder, including this Order, or the EASA Regulation, as regards personnel 
licencing, aircraft operations, continuing airworthiness, air navigation, or rules 
of the air. 

Duties and Responsibilities of the Flying Display Director
text_norm: 10 permission issued order shall purport grant additional permission privilege exemption aircraft operator pilot aircraft may required act order direction thereunder including order easa regulation regard personnel licencing aircraft operation continuing airworthiness air navigation rule air duty responsibility flying display director

text_raw:
11. The Flying Display Director shall be responsible for the safe conduct of

title: “flying display” means any flying activity deliberately performed for the
heading: 12. The Flying Display Director who has been granted permission for a
text_raw:
12. The Flying Display Director who has been granted permission for a 
flying display must comply with any conditions associated with that 
permission. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [23]
text_norm: 12 flying display director granted permission flying display must comply condition associated permission 4 23

title: “flying display” means any flying activity deliberately performed for the
heading: 13. The Flying Display Director must not permit any person to act as pilot
text_raw:
13. The Flying Display Director must not permit any person to act as pilot 
of an aircraft which participates in a flying display unless the Flying Display 
Director has determined that the pilot is competent to undertake the display 
concerned.
text_norm: 13 flying display director must permit person act pilot aircraft participates flying display unless flying display director determined pilot competent undertake display concerned

title: “flying display” means any flying activity deliberately performed for the
heading: 14. The Flying Display Director shall not act as pilot-in-command of an
text_raw:
14. The Flying Display Director shall not act as pilot-in-command of an 
aircraft partaking in any flying display for which they have been granted 
permission under Article 5 of this Order.
text_norm: 14 flying display director shall act pilot-in-command aircraft partaking flying display granted permission article 5 order

title: “flying display” means any flying activity deliberately performed for the
heading: 15. The Flying Display Director shall remain present for the duration of the
text_raw:
15. The Flying Display Director shall remain present for the duration of the 

flying display. 

Duties and Responsibilities of the pilot-in-command
text_norm: 15 flying display director shall remain present duration flying display duty responsibility pilot-in-command

title: “flying display” means any flying activity deliberately performed for the
heading: 16. The pilot-in-command of an aircraft who is intending to participate in a
text_raw:
16. The pilot-in-command of an aircraft who is intending to participate in a 
flying display must take all reasonable steps to be satisfied, before 
participating, that— 

(a) 

(b) 

the Flying Display Director has been granted an appropriate 
permission under Article 5; 

the intended flight can comply with any relevant conditions 
subject to which that permission may have been granted; and
text_norm: 16 pilot-in-command aircraft intending participate flying display must take reasonable step satisfied participating that-- (a) (b) flying display director granted appropriate permission article 5 intended flight comply relevant condition subject permission may granted

title: “flying display” means any flying activity deliberately performed for the
heading: 17. The pilot-in-command of an aircraft who is participating in a flying
text_raw:
17. The pilot-in-command of an aircraft who is participating in a flying 

display must comply with any conditions associated with that permission.
text_norm: 17 pilot-in-command aircraft participating flying display must comply condition associated permission

title: “flying display” means any flying activity deliberately performed for the
heading: 18. No person may be carried during flights for the purpose of flying
text_raw:
18. No person may be carried during flights for the purpose of flying 
displays or demonstration flying (except for the minimum required flight crew) 
unless specified in the permission issued under Article 5. 

Directions
text_norm: 18 person may carried flight purpose flying display demonstration flying (except minimum required flight crew) unless specified permission issued article 5 direction

title: “flying display” means any flying activity deliberately performed for the
heading: 19. The Authority may give directions for the purposes of giving effect to
text_raw:
19. The Authority may give directions for the purposes of giving effect to 
the provisions of this Order, and may exempt natural or legal persons, or 
operations from the provisions of this Order, subject to such conditions as may 
be specified in relation to any such exemption. A condition specified in or 
with a written permission or in relation to an exemption in a particular case 
shall have the effect of a direction under this Order and shall be complied with 
by the person or persons to whom it applies. 

Insurance
text_norm: 19 authority may give direction purpose giving effect provision order may exempt natural legal person operation provision order subject condition may specified relation exemption condition specified written permission relation exemption particular case shall effect direction order shall complied person person applies insurance

title: “flying display” means any flying activity deliberately performed for the
heading: 20. The Flying Display Director shall ensure that the operator of any
text_raw:
20. The Flying Display Director shall ensure that the operator of any 
aircraft engaged in a flying display shall hold appropriate third-party liability 
insurance for the flying activities undertaken at that specific flying display. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [23] 5 

Notification of accidents and incidents
text_norm: 20 flying display director shall ensure operator aircraft engaged flying display shall hold appropriate third-party liability insurance flying activity undertaken specific flying display 23 5 notification accident incident

title: “flying display” means any flying activity deliberately performed for the
heading: 21. Where an incident occurs during a flying display, the Flying Display
text_raw:
21. Where an incident occurs during a flying display, the Flying Display 
Director shall send notice of the incident to the Authority, and where required 
by S.I. 460 of 2009 (Air Navigation (Notification and Investigation of 
Accidents, Serious Incidents and Incidents) Regulations 2009), to the Air 
Accident Investigation Unit. 

Investigations
text_norm: 21 incident occurs flying display flying display director shall send notice incident authority required s.i 460 2009 (air navigation (notification investigation accident serious incident incidents) regulation 2009) air accident investigation unit investigation

title: “flying display” means any flying activity deliberately performed for the
heading: 22. In accordance with Section 65 of the Act of 1993, the Authority may
text_raw:
22. In accordance with Section 65 of the Act of 1993, the Authority may 
obtain from any individual, such information which is within their knowledge 
or procurement, as may reasonably be required for the purposes of an 
investigation in relation to an incident which occurred during a flying display.
text_norm: 22 accordance section 65 act 1993 authority may obtain individual information within knowledge procurement may reasonably required purpose investigation relation incident occurred flying display

title: “flying display” means any flying activity deliberately performed for the
heading: 23. The Authority may:
text_raw:
23. The Authority may: 

(a) Cause such 

inspections as 

investigations or 

it considers 
appropriate to be made in respect of an occurrence, related to a 
flying display. For the purposes of such investigation or 
inspection, the Authority may detain an aircraft, take copies of 
or extracts from any documents or records (including the records 
in any electronic flight data), have access to any place or 
premises and obtain from any person such information as may 
reasonably be required, and 

(b) For the purpose of such investigations, the Authority may 
require the attendance of any person at a specified place and 
time on a specified day.
text_norm: 23 authority may (a) cause inspection investigation considers appropriate made respect occurrence related flying display purpose investigation inspection authority may detain aircraft take copy extract document record (including record electronic flight data) access place premise obtain person information may reasonably required (b) purpose investigation authority may require attendance person specified place time specified day

title: “flying display” means any flying activity deliberately performed for the
heading: 24. This Order shall apply without prejudice to the roles and responsibility
text_raw:
24. This Order shall apply without prejudice to the roles and responsibility 
of the Air Accident Investigation Unit relating to accident investigation, as set 
out in the Air Navigation (Notification and Investigation of Accidents, Serious 
Incidents and Incidents) Regulations 2009. 

Power to Prevent an Aircraft from Flying
text_norm: 24 order shall apply without prejudice role responsibility air accident investigation unit relating accident investigation set air navigation (notification investigation accident serious incident incidents) regulation 2009 power prevent aircraft flying

title: “flying display” means any flying activity deliberately performed for the
heading: 25. If it appears to the Authority or an authorised officer of the company,
text_raw:
25. If it appears to the Authority or an authorised officer of the company, 
that an aircraft is likely to be operated in contravention of the EASA 
Regulation, the Act, this Order, or any Directions thereunder, they may direct 
the pilot-in-command, or a Flying Display Director, not to operate, or grant 
permission to operate, the aircraft concerned. The Authority or an authorised 
officer of the company may take such steps as are necessary to detain that 
aircraft at a suitable location. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [23]

Authorisations and Directions

title: “flying display” means any flying activity deliberately performed for the
heading: (This note is not part of the Order and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Order and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

This Order provides for the Authority to grant permissions for flying displays 
in the State, including provisions for the role and responsibilities of Flying 
Display Directors and the pilot-in-command of an aircraft participating in a 
flying display.
